page.title: 14Parish Church of Ecchinswell
page.content: {St.Lawrence's Church}in Ecchinswell was founded in 1885.The original church by the river became very delapidated.Funds were raised in the village and a piece of land donated to build the church.The old church was demolished and only the altar,font and a few tiles retained.The old graveyard remains.The new church is built in late Gothic revival style of flint with Bath stone dressing,it has a wooden spire and weathercock rising to 70feet.Built to hold 200 people,the normal average congregation is 35. The medieval font once had a cover which was kept locked to stop witches stealing the holy water.At some period the locks were broken and the cover lost.The present cover is Victorian. The vicarage was sold in 1978 when the United Benefice was formed.The vicar today lives in a modern bungalow.
